mrmc.core

Class StatTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • mrmc.core.StatTest

  • public class StatTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Statistical calculations on study data. Hillis tests and Z test are implemented Hillis tests require non-central F distribution. The formula is from http://www.mathworks.com/help/toolbox/stats/brn2ivz-110.html
    Author:
    Xin He, Ph.D,, Brandon D. Gallas, Ph.D, Rohan Pathare

      • doVar

      • calcDF_BDGbckIndep

        public double calcDF_BDGbckIndep(DBRecord curRecord)
        In this DF estimation method ...
        The BCK components of variance are used following Satterthwaite instead of mean squares
        This follows Eq. 4 Gaylor1969_Technometrics_v4p691
        Each contribution to the denominator of the Satterthwaite approximation
        takes the form (contribution to the variance)^2 / (df of contribution to the variance)
        Each contribution to var_A, var_B, covAB is treated separately.
        Parameters:
        curRecord - DBRecord
        Returns:
        Degrees of freedom

      • calcDF_BDGbckGroup

        public double calcDF_BDGbckGroup(DBRecord curRecord)
        In this DF estimation method ...
        The BCK components of variance are used following Satterthwaite instead of mean squares
        This follows Eq. 4 Gaylor1969_Technometrics_v4p691
        Each contribution to the denominator of the Satterthwaite approximation
        takes the form (contribution to the variance)^2 / (df of contribution to the variance)
        When the covariance term exists, the
        contribution to the variance = contribution to (var_A + var_B - 2*covAB)
        Otherwise the contribution to var_A and var_B are treated separately.
        Parameters:
        curRecord - DBRecord
        Returns:
        Degrees of freedom

      • calcDF_BDGms

        public double calcDF_BDGms(DBRecord curRecord)
        In this DF estimation method ... When the readers, normal cases, disease cases are all paired across modalities I use the an approximate Satterthwaite method based on mean squares as outlined in Obuchowski2012_Acad-Radiol_v19p1508 When the normal cases are unpaired, I treat the modality specific mean squares separately. When the disease cases are unpaired, I treat the modality specific mean squares separately. When readers are unpaired, I treat the modality specific mean squares separately.
        Parameters:
        curRecord - DBRecord
        Returns:
        Degrees of freedom

      • calcDF_Hillis

        public double calcDF_Hillis(DBRecord curRecord)
        Calculates the denominator degrees of freedom by Hillis 2008 method given the curRecord, which can be DBRecordStat or DBRecordSize

      • PowerFtest

        public double[] PowerFtest(double df,
                  double lambda)
        Calculates the statistical power by non-central f-test
        Parameters:
        df - Degrees of freedom
        lambda - Non-centrality parameter
        Returns:
        Statistical power assuming a non-central F-distribution

      • cdfNonCentralF

        public double cdfNonCentralF(int df1,
                    int df2,
                    double delta,
                    double x)
        Calculates the cumulative distribution function for a beta distribution
        Parameters:
        df1 - First degrees of freedom parameter
        df2 - Second degrees of freedom parameter
        delta - f-statistic
        x - f0/CVF
        Returns:
        CDF value

      • PowerZtest

        public double[] PowerZtest()
        Calculates statistical power via z-test
        Returns:
        Statistical power assuming normality
